meanings.definition: A division or district of a city or town for administrative or political purposes.
meanings.sent1: The city council discussed the new boundaries for the different wards.
meanings.sent2: Residents of the northern ward voted for their representative in the local elections.
meanings.sent3: In the game, each player had to control a different ward of the imaginary city.
meanings.sent4: The political candidate focused on winning over voters in the industrial ward.
meanings.sent5: The bustling market was located right at the heart of the commercial ward.

meanings.definition: A person, especially a child, under the care and protection of a guardian or court.
meanings.sent1: The orphanage provided a safe home for many wards who had lost their parents.
meanings.sent2: The court appointed a legal guardian to look after the young ward's interests.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous ward managed to sneak out of the house past bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The caring teacher treated each student as her own ward, guiding them through challenges.
meanings.sent5: The kind-hearted couple decided to adopt a new ward into their loving family.

meanings.definition: A separate room in a hospital for patients.
meanings.sent1: The hospital had to open up additional wards to accommodate the influx of flu patients.
meanings.sent2: The surgical ward was kept meticulously clean to prevent infections.
meanings.sent3: The patient in the next ward over kept playing loud music late into the night.
meanings.sent4: The hospital staff worked tirelessly to ensure each ward was properly equipped and staffed.
meanings.sent5: The children's ward was decorated with colorful murals to create a cheerful atmosphere.
